summary:
Around the new Avengers facility, Tony periodically sends Thor ravens with trivial information:

“Dinner's ready.” “Hath thee...
caption:
Around the new Avengers facility, Tony periodically sends Thor ravens with trivial information:

“Dinner’s ready.”

“Hath thee ever met thine rival Zeus?”
“Have you seen my Ray-Bans?”
“Elevator installed; bring hammer.”

title: Koschei
body:
“It was beautiful. Like nothing I’ve ever seen before. It was like an everlasting sunset on a plane of nothingness.” - Ava Collins

Simul Nos Firmiores

We are getting ready to leave for Sokovia. Banner, Stark, myself, and Steve are talking.“No way we all get through this. If even one tin soldier is left standing, we’ve lost. It’s gonna be blood on…

Read more…

blog.name: the-insomniac-writes
blog.title: Marvel Sh*tposts And Other Funny Stuff

summary: I feel like most of the Avengers live by the quote "Be who you needed when you were younger" when interacting with people...
body:
I feel like most of the Avengers live by the quote “Be who you needed when you were younger” when interacting with people younger than them

  • Tony Stark (like he does with Peter) encourages and reminds teens/kids of all the positive things they do right and that their self worth isn’t in their achievements
  • Tony reminds the kids that they’re loved, if not at home, then by him
  • Tony reminds them that it’s okay to fail; that doesn’t make them a failure
  • Tony takes care of teens who lost their parents and kids/teens in rehab from different addictions
  • Tony makes sure kids/teens have a safe place and person to turn to because he knows that financial need isn’t the only concern a lot of these kids face and emotional issues are just as big
  • Natasha Romanoff (Natalia Romanova) looks out for people of any gender, but especially girls, being abused/trafficked (especially when they’re on missions and raiding HYDRA bases)
  • Nat makes sure that they get somewhere safe and that they feel safe (but not trapped)
  • Nat doesn’t push them for details, make them talk, or even touch them without consent
  • Nat protects and defends them from people who want to interrogate them for information or those who try to rush their progress
  • Nat knows that a kind word and a smile means, just as much, or even more, than the food and shelter, even if they don’t show it
  • Nat knows that every person heals at their own rate (she’s still healing) and makes sure not to push; everything she does is with consent and she makes sure to know her boundaries around them so that they feel safe
  • Steve Rogers protects all kids, but mainly those who aren’t able to defend themselves (“I don’t like bullies; I don’t care where they’re from”)
  • Steve also helps out kids who are sick or have poor health in different ways, but mainly by hanging out with them, doing physical therapy with them, and encouraging them when they feel weak(er)
  • Steve makes sure that kids who are weaker than others or who have various illnesses don’t feel as if they are worth less because of this or that they are less of a person; he makes sure that they know that their self worth is in the character and how they behave
  • Steve is a very encouraging person, especially when people are trying to achieve a goal and are feeling dejected (he got rejected from the army multiple times)
  • Peter Parker stands up and cheers for the little guys; whether it’s standing up to a bully or helping some kids build a lemonade stand, he’s always ready to chip in
  • Peter encourages kids to pursue their passions: from helping a first grader build a volcano to cheering on a junior higher at their piano recital, he wants to make sure that kids aren’t peer or parent pressured into doing something mainstream instead of what they want
  • Peter never embarrasses kids for making a mistake: especially bullies and other kids. That’s not to say that he won’t get justice (tell a teacher), but he refuses to publicly humiliate a bully; he knows that everyone has a reason for their actions (especially kids) and although that doesn’t justify their actions, it’s still important to understand the bully as much as it is to understand the victim (he knows how easy it is to act out of anger when you’re hurting or grieving)
  • Peter helps boys who don’t have a strong male role model in their lives by being an example to them, encouraging them, teaching them life skills, keeping them accountable, and letting them know that they have a safe place to talk with him

I could honestly go on and on with these but I’m going to stop it here for now…

summary: First Ant-Man and the Wasp reactions are in, tease refresher from Avengers Infinity War’s mayhem | hollywood
title: First Ant-Man and the Wasp reactions are in, tease refresher from Avengers Infinity War’s mayhem | hollywood
body:
First Ant-Man and the Wasp reactions are in, tease refresher from Avengers Infinity War’s mayhem | hollywood

[ad_1]

The first batch of screenings for Ant-Man and the Wasp were held on Thursday, and in a typically bullish move by Marvel. No embargoes were enforced on social media reactions. The first round of tweets have hit the web, and they’re unanimous in praise for Marvel’s latest superhero movie.

Several critics and lucky audience members said that Ant-Man and the Wasp, the sequel to 2015’s relative…

View On WordPress

blog.name: kyasuu
blog.title: call no man happy until he is dead

summary: Tony/rhodey prompt because it IS a crime there's not more whump fics for them: Rhodey is really observent when the other...
question: Tony/rhodey prompt because it IS a crime there's not more whump fics for them: Rhodey is really observent when the other avengers aren't. Tony's working without blasting his music, not touching his coffee, and just quiet overall, but Rhodey decides to leave Tony alone about it because he swears he's just exhausted. But when Tony misses an avengers meeting with Fury and the others come to the tower to chew him out, Rhodey knows what's actually up and they go check on him instead of yelling <3
answer:
heRE YOU GO!! it’s under the cut!

James knows there’s something wrong the second he lays eyes on his best friend. “Rhodey!” Tony calls cheerfully, turning towards him as James walks into the workshop. “How are you, dear?”

James’s eyebrows knit together, internally counting up everything that’s wrong with this scene. One: JARVIS hadn’t greeted him. Two: there’s no obnoxiously loud music. Three: there’s only one, half-empty mug of coffee sitting on the bench. And four: Tony hadn’t thrown himself at James and plastered himself on him like a human starfish.

“Never mind me, how are you, man?” he asks, approaching his best friend. He expects Tony to brush it off and make a joke about how he’s Absolutely Totally Utterly Fine, but instead, the man deflates a little and says, “That obvious, huh?”

Mildly alarmed, James crosses the rest of the distance to press a hand to Tony’s forehead. It’s not really all that warm; maybe a little more so than what’s probably normal, but it’s not that concerning. Tony doesn’t protest, only giving a light huff. “I’m just tired, honey,” Tony reassures him, gently prying James’s hand off of his forehead. “When I’m finished down here, I’ll take some meds and sleep it off.”

James hesitates, but given the fact that Tony seems to be taking care of himself somewhat well, he decides to let it go. “Alright, then,” he says, sighing. “But make sure you unmute JARVIS so he can let us know if anything goes wrong.”

Tony rolls his eyes and waves a hand. “Yes, Mother,” he sighs. “You’re unmuted, J.”

“Thank you, Colonel Rhodes.”

“I’ll leave you to it, then, Tony,” James calls, heading out the way he’d come.

Tony doesn’t reemerge the rest of the day, but then again, the tower is huge. He could’ve disappeared somewhere while James wasn’t paying attention, and JARVIS hadn’t said anything, so he’s not too concerned.

The elevator dings, and James turns towards it as the Avengers step through, expressions of varying intensities of irritation all crossing their faces. Did something happen…?

“Rhodes!” calls Barton, irritation in his tone. “Man, have you seen Tony around? He missed a meeting today. Jeez, he can’t get away with everything just because he’s rich.”

There’s a sinking feeling in James’s stomach. “I saw him earlier, but…” He breaks off to curse. “Fuck! That idiot!” It isn’t like Tony to skip out on meetings without rubbing it in everyone’s faces. “He wasn’t looking too great earlier.”

James immediately heads towards the elevator, urgency in every action. “God, that dumbass,” he mutters, pushing past Barton. Knowing him, he’d muted JARVIS as soon as the AI was going to talk to someone about his condition.

“Wait, he was sick?” There’s a touch of guilt amidst the concern in Rogers’s voice. “Why didn’t he call in?”

As the Avengers who’d come in crowd into the elevator again, James gives the supersoldier his most unimpressed eyebrow raise. “Have you met the man?” he asks, and Rogers sighs.

“Stupid question, I know.”

The elevator dings again and the doors open. James practically races into the workshop, and his heart nearly stops when he sees his best friend collapsed halfway onto the couch; he hadn’t had the energy to even get onto it, evidently.

“Tony,” he calls urgently, bending down and dragging him fully onto the couch. He can practically feel the heat radiating off of him, and his heart gives another painful stop.

Thankfully, Tony stirs, eyes fluttering open tiredly to meet James’s gaze. “Rh’dey?” he slurs tiredly. “Wh’re you doing here?” Behind him, James can hear the rest of the Avengers crowding around the couch. “…Barton?”

“Most of us are here,” says Romanoff, voice quiet and pitched soothingly low. “Thor went off with Bruce, though we’ll call them back if we need to.”

“Mm,” is all Tony says, voice thick with sleep, exhaustion, and fever. Rogers, bless him, heads over with a glass of water and a wet towel, handing them wordlessly to James.

“C’mon, Tony, drink a little water.” James helps Tony sit up, holding the glass of water to his lips. Tony makes a low noise of protest but with a little more cajoling, he drinks about half of the glass before James sets it on the table.

“JARVIS, unmute,” James calls.

The AI gives a disgruntled, “Thank you, Colonel Rhodes. Sir’s temperature is 102.3, and has been unconscious over the couch for approximately two hours. His temperature has only risen.”

“Jeez, take better care of yourself,” Barton grumbles as James sets Tony back down on the couch gently. The archer hands James a pillow he’d snagged from a nearby bench, and he shoves it under Tony’s head before draping the towel over his forehead.

“Asking the impossible here, Barton,” Romanoff replies dryly, but not without a touch of fondness and exasperation as takes a seat by Tony’s head, carefully carding a hand through his hair. 

“You guys are…” Tony yawns, and James smiles fondly. “Mean…” 

“Only ‘cause we care about you, idiot,” James sighs. “Get well soon, Tony.”
answer_abstract: heRE YOU GO!! it’s under the cut!

Tony doesn’t reemerge the rest of the day, but then again, the tower is huge. He could’ve disappeared somewhere while James wasn’t paying attention, and JARVIS hadn’t said anything, so he’s not too concerned.

The elevator dings, and James turns towards it as the Avengers step through, expressions of varying intensities of irritation all crossing their faces. Did something happen…?

“Rhodes!” calls Barton, irritation in his tone. “Man, have you seen Tony around? He missed a meeting today. Jeez, he can’t get away with everything just because he’s rich.”

There’s a sinking feeling in James’s stomach. “I saw him earlier, but…” He breaks off to curse. “Fuck! That idiot!” It isn’t like Tony to skip out on meetings without rubbing it in everyone’s faces. “He wasn’t looking too great earlier.”

James immediately heads towards the elevator, urgency in every action. “God, that dumbass,” he mutters, pushing past Barton. Knowing him, he’d muted JARVIS as soon as the AI was going to talk to someone about his condition.

“Wait, he was sick?” There’s a touch of guilt amidst the concern in Rogers’s voice. “Why didn’t he call in?”

As the Avengers who’d come in crowd into the elevator again, James gives the supersoldier his most unimpressed eyebrow raise. “Have you met the man?” he asks, and Rogers sighs.

“Stupid question, I know.”

The elevator dings again and the doors open. James practically races into the workshop, and his heart nearly stops when he sees his best friend collapsed halfway onto the couch; he hadn’t had the energy to even get onto it, evidently.

“Tony,” he calls urgently, bending down and dragging him fully onto the couch. He can practically feel the heat radiating off of him, and his heart gives another painful stop.

Thankfully, Tony stirs, eyes fluttering open tiredly to meet James’s gaze. “Rh’dey?” he slurs tiredly. “Wh’re you doing here?” Behind him, James can hear the rest of the Avengers crowding around the couch. “…Barton?”

“Most of us are here,” says Romanoff, voice quiet and pitched soothingly low. “Thor went off with Bruce, though we’ll call them back if we need to.”

“Mm,” is all Tony says, voice thick with sleep, exhaustion, and fever. Rogers, bless him, heads over with a glass of water and a wet towel, handing them wordlessly to James.

“C’mon, Tony, drink a little water.” James helps Tony sit up, holding the glass of water to his lips. Tony makes a low noise of protest but with a little more cajoling, he drinks about half of the glass before James sets it on the table.

“JARVIS, unmute,” James calls.

The AI gives a disgruntled, “Thank you, Colonel Rhodes. Sir’s temperature is 102.3, and has been unconscious over the couch for approximately two hours. His temperature has only risen.”

“Jeez, take better care of yourself,” Barton grumbles as James sets Tony back down on the couch gently. The archer hands James a pillow he’d snagged from a nearby bench, and he shoves it under Tony’s head before draping the towel over his forehead.

“Asking the impossible here, Barton,” Romanoff replies dryly, but not without a touch of fondness and exasperation as takes a seat by Tony’s head, carefully carding a hand through his hair. 

“You guys are…” Tony yawns, and James smiles fondly. “Mean…” 

“Only ‘cause we care about you, idiot,” James sighs. “Get well soon, Tony.”

trail.content_raw:
heRE YOU GO!! it’s under the cut!

[[MORE]]

James knows there’s something wrong the second he lays eyes on his best friend. “Rhodey!” Tony calls cheerfully, turning towards him as James walks into the workshop. “How are you, dear?”

James’s eyebrows knit together, internally counting up everything that’s wrong with this scene. One: JARVIS hadn’t greeted him. Two: there’s no obnoxiously loud music. Three: there’s only one, half-empty mug of coffee sitting on the bench. And four: Tony hadn’t thrown himself at James and plastered himself on him like a human starfish.

“Never mind me, how are you, man?” he asks, approaching his best friend. He expects Tony to brush it off and make a joke about how he’s Absolutely Totally Utterly Fine, but instead, the man deflates a little and says, “That obvious, huh?”

Mildly alarmed, James crosses the rest of the distance to press a hand to Tony’s forehead. It’s not really all that warm; maybe a little more so than what’s probably normal, but it’s not that concerning. Tony doesn’t protest, only giving a light huff. “I’m just tired, honey,” Tony reassures him, gently prying James’s hand off of his forehead. “When I’m finished down here, I’ll take some meds and sleep it off.”

James hesitates, but given the fact that Tony seems to be taking care of himself somewhat well, he decides to let it go. “Alright, then,” he says, sighing. “But make sure you unmute JARVIS so he can let us know if anything goes wrong.”

Tony rolls his eyes and waves a hand. “Yes, Mother,” he sighs. “You’re unmuted, J.”

“Thank you, Colonel Rhodes.”

“I’ll leave you to it, then, Tony,” James calls, heading out the way he’d come.

Tony doesn’t reemerge the rest of the day, but then again, the tower is huge. He could’ve disappeared somewhere while James wasn’t paying attention, and JARVIS hadn’t said anything, so he’s not too concerned.

title: Ice to meet you
body:
Serena is thrown into the world of SHIELD whether she likes it or not.

What happens at SHIELD

My body felt numb, I couldn’t move a muscle. Finally, my eyes opened, and I took in my surroundings; a large lab, with lots of screens. I winced, looking at my bandages arm, the bandage red with dried…

Read more…

summary: The avengers are doing their part to dismantle toxic masculinity

The avengers are doing their part to dismantle toxic masculinity

Through silliness and dancing and male affection
